On the one hand, the job pays well. On the other hand, it requires long hours.

Por un lado, el trabajo paga bien. Por otro lado, requiere muchas horas.

Connecting words

This time next week, I’ll be presenting the project to the entire board.

A esta hora la próxima semana, estaré presentando el proyecto ante toda la junta.

Future Continuous

Will you be using the printer later? I need to make some copies.

¿Estarás usando la impresora más tarde? Necesito hacer unas copias.

Future Continuous

Don’t call me at 10 PM; I’ll be watching the season finale.

No me llames a las 10 PM; estaré viendo el final de temporada.

Future Continuous

By the end of the year, we’ll be living in a different country.

Para finales del año, estaremos viviendo en otro país.

Future Continuous

Will they be attending the training session tomorrow morning?

¿Asistirán a la sesión de capacitación mañana por la mañana?

Future Continuous

She won’t be joining us for dinner because she’ll be attending a conference.

Ella no se unirá a nosotros para cenar porque estará asistiendo a una conferencia.

Future Continuous

At this time tomorrow, you’ll be flying over the Atlantic Ocean.

A esta hora mañana, estarás volando sobre el Océano Atlántico.

Future Continuous

What will you be doing while we’re on vacation?

¿Qué estarás haciendo mientras estemos de vacaciones?

Future Continuous

I’ll be working from home the entire week due to the renovations at the office.

Estaré trabajando desde casa toda la semana debido a las renovaciones en la oficina.

Future Continuous

Reductor Paradigma 1 después de la lección Parte 3 - Módulo 1 - Historia #2 Jonny en un callejón sin salida

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tipo reducción

Tiempo

Verbo Clave

Are you feeling under the weather?

¿Te sientes mal?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Feel

Yes, I am feeling under the weather.

Sí, me siento mal.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Feel

Did you bite the bullet yesterday?

¿Tomaste la decisión difícil ayer?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Bite

Yes, I bit the bullet and did it.

Sí, tomé la decisión y lo hice.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Bite

Are you sweating bullets?

¿Estás sudando mucho?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Sweat

No, I am not sweating bullets.

No, no estoy sudando mucho.

Afirmación Negativa

Presente

Sweat

When did you get off work?

¿Cuándo saliste del trabajo?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Get

I got off work at six o'clock.

Salí del trabajo a las seis.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Get

Were you mugged last night?

¿Te asaltaron anoche?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Mug

No, I was not mugged last night.

No, no me asaltaron anoche.

Afirmación Negativa

Pasado

Mug

Is the thief dangerous?

¿El ladrón es peligroso?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Be

Yes, the thief is dangerous.

Sí, el ladrón es peligroso.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Be

Are you sick today?

¿Estás enfermo hoy?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Be

Yes, I am sick today.

Sí, estoy enfermo hoy.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Be

Do you think this is dangerous?

¿Crees que esto es peligroso?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Think

Yes, I think it is dangerous.

Sí, creo que es peligroso.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Think

Why are you late?

¿Por qué llegaste tarde?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Be

Because the bus was late.

Porque el bus llegó tarde.

Afirmación Negativa

Pasado

Be

Why do you study English?

¿Por qué estudias inglés?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Study

Because I want to travel.

Porque quiero viajar.

Respuesta

Presente

Want

Would you like some coffee?

¿Te gustaría un poco de café?

Pregunta Positiva

Condicional

Would

Yes, I would like some coffee.

Sí, me gustaría un poco de café.

Afirmación Positiva

Condicional

Would

Would you help me with this?

¿Me ayudarías con esto?

Pregunta Positiva

Condicional

Would

Yes, I would help you.

Sí, te ayudaría.

Afirmación Positiva

Condicional

Would

Reductor Idioms/Slangs 1 después de la lección + MÁS SLANGS

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tipo reducción

Tiempo

Is "Out of sight, out of mind" true?

¿Es cierto el dicho "Ojos que no ven, corazón que no siente"? (Este refrán se refiere a que tendemos a olvidar lo que no vemos constantemente)

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, it is true.

Sí, es cierto.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Is going to the party out of the question?

¿Está descartado ir a la fiesta?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

No, it is not out of the question.

No, no está descartado.

Afirmación Negativa

Presente

Is the store out of the way?

¿La tienda queda lejos/apartada?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, it is out of the way.

Sí, queda lejos/apartada.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Is this car out of my budget?

¿Este carro está fuera de mi presupuesto?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, it is out of my budget.

Sí, está fuera de mi presupuesto.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Is this food out of this world?

¿Esta comida está increíble/buenísima?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, this food is out of this world.

Sí, esta comida está increíble.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Is she out of the picture now?

¿Ya no cuenta con ella?/¿Ya no está en la jugada? (es decir, ya no es tomada en cuenta)

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, she is out of the picture.

Sí, ya no cuenta/ya no está en la jugada.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Are you out of practice in swimming?

¿Hace rato que no practicas natación?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, I am out of practice.

Sí, hace rato que no practico.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Are you out of respect for your teacher?

¿Lo haces por respeto a tu profesor?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, I am out of respect.

Sí, lo hago por respeto.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Did you hit the books last night?

¿Te pusiste a estudiar anoche?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, I hit the books.

Sí, me puse a estudiar.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did the cat appear out of nowhere?

¿Apareció el gato de la nada?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, the cat appeared out of nowhere.

Sí, el gato apareció de la nada.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Reductor Facilísimo M2 después lección Facilísimo Módulo 2

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tipo reducción

Tiempo Verbo Clave

Are you kidding me?

¿Me estás tomando el pelo?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente continuo

No, I’m serious.

No, hablo en serio.

Afirmación Negativa

Presente simple

Do you wanna eat pizza?

¿Quieres comer pizza?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, I wanna eat pizza.

Sí, quiero comer pizza.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

What do you worry about?

¿Por qué te preocupas?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente simple

I worry about my exams.

Me preocupo por mis exámenes.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente simple

Does he worry too much?

¿Él se preocupa demasiado?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente simple

No, he doesn't worry a lot.

No, él no se preocupa mucho.

Afirmación Negativa

Presente simple

What does she study?

¿Qué estudia ella?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente simple

She studies medicine.

Ella estudia medicina.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente simple

Is this his book?

¿Este es su libro? (de él)

Pregunta Positiva

Presente simple

Yes, it’s his book.

Sí, es su libro.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente simple

Is that her phone?

¿Ese es su teléfono? (de ella)

Pregunta Positiva

Presente simple

No, that’s not her phone.

No, ese no es su teléfono.

Afirmación Negativa

Presente simple

Are you kidding me?

¿Estás bromeando conmigo?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente continuo

No, I’m not kidding you.

No, no estoy bromeando contigo.

Afirmación Negativa

Presente continuo

Do you wanna go outside?

¿Quieres salir?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, I wanna go outside.

Sí, quiero salir.

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

What are his worries?

¿Cuáles son sus preocupaciones?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente simple

His worries are about school.

Sus preocupaciones son sobre la escuela.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente simple

What does she study?

¿Qué estudia ella?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente simple

She studies English.

Ella estudia inglés.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente simple

Is this his pencil?

¿Este es su lápiz? (de él)

Pregunta Positiva

Presente simple

Yes, it’s his pencil.

Sí, es su lápiz.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente simple

Is that her notebook?

¿Ese es su cuaderno? (de ella)

Pregunta Positiva

Presente simple

No, it’s not her notebook.

No, no es su cuaderno.

Afirmación Negativa

Presente simple

Reductor Modals B1 (Modals – must/can’t deduction, Modals – might, may, will, probably, Modals – should have/might have/etc, Modals – must/have to) después de la lección M2 MIRA ESTE VIDEO ANTES DE VER LA HISTORIA

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

She must be exhausted after that long hike.

Ella debe estar agotada después de esa larga caminata.

must/can’t deduction

He can’t be serious about quitting his job.

No puede estar hablando en serio sobre renunciar a su trabajo.

must/can’t deduction

You must have left your keys at the café.

Debes haber dejado tus llaves en el café.

must/can’t deduction

They can’t have finished already—it’s too soon.

No pueden haber terminado ya; es demasiado pronto.

must/can’t deduction

That must be his sister; they look exactly alike.

Esa debe ser su hermana; se parecen muchísimo.

must/can’t deduction

She can’t be older than 25—she looks really young.

No puede tener más de 25 años; se ve muy joven.

must/can’t deduction

You must be joking. There’s no way we’re late!

Debes estar bromeando. ¡No hay forma de que lleguemos tarde!

must/can’t deduction

He must be the new manager everyone is talking about.

Él debe ser el nuevo gerente del que todos hablan.

must/can’t deduction

She might come to the meeting if she finishes early.

Ella podría venir a la reunión si termina temprano.

might/may/will/probably

They may not agree with our proposal.

Puede que no estén de acuerdo con nuestra propuesta.

might/may/will/probably

He will probably arrive late—he’s always stuck in traffic.

Probablemente llegue tarde; siempre está atrapado en el tráfico.

might/may/will/probably

We might have to cancel the trip due to bad weather.

Puede que tengamos que cancelar el viaje por mal clima.

might/may/will/probably

It may take a while to get the results.

Puede que tarde un poco en llegar los resultados.

might/may/will/probably

You’ll probably enjoy the show—it has great reviews.

Probablemente disfrutes del espectáculo; tiene excelentes reseñas.

might/may/will/probably

He might not pass the exam if he doesn’t study harder.

Puede que no apruebe el examen si no estudia más.

might/may/will/probably

She may already know about the surprise.

Puede que ella ya sepa sobre la sorpresa.

might/may/will/probably

You should have told me earlier.

Deberías haberme dicho antes.

should have/might have/etc

He might have forgotten our appointment.

Puede que haya olvidado nuestra cita.

should have/might have/etc

They could have taken the wrong train.

Podrían haber tomado el tren equivocado.

should have/might have/etc

I shouldn’t have trusted him so easily.

No debería haber confiado en él tan fácilmente.

should have/might have/etc

She might not have seen your message.

Puede que no haya visto tu mensaje.

should have/might have/etc

We should have planned the event better.

Deberíamos haber planeado mejor el evento.

should have/might have/etc

He could have won if he had trained harder.

Podría haber ganado si hubiera entrenado más.

should have/might have/etc

You might have misunderstood what she said.

Puede que hayas malinterpretado lo que ella dijo.

should have/might have/etc

You must wear a helmet when riding a bike.

Debes usar casco cuando montas bicicleta.

must/have to

She has to finish the report by tomorrow.

Ella tiene que terminar el informe para mañana.

must/have to

We must be respectful during the meeting.

Debemos ser respetuosos durante la reunión.

must/have to

They have to follow the safety regulations at all times.

Ellos tienen que seguir las normas de seguridad en todo momento.

must/have to

You must not smoke inside the building.

No debes fumar dentro del edificio.

must/have to

He has to attend the conference next week.

Él tiene que asistir a la conferencia la próxima semana.

must/have to

We must leave early to catch the train.

Debemos salir temprano para alcanzar el tren.

must/have to

She has to take the medicine twice a day.

Ella tiene que tomar la medicina dos veces al día.

must/have to

You must keep your ID visible at all times.

Debes mantener tu identificación visible en todo momento.

must/have to

They have to complete the application form by Friday.

Ellos tienen que completar el formulario de inscripción para el viernes.

must/have to

Reductor PasCont+PasSim+PasTenResponse (Past continuous, Past perfect, Past simple, Past tense responses) después de la lección Técnica Writing

Inglés

Español

Tiempo Verbal

Did you attend the seminar last week?

¿Asististe al seminario la semana pasada?

Past Simple

Did she quit her job so suddenly?

¿Por qué renunció a su trabajo tan de repente?

Past Simple

Did she tell me the whole story?

No, ella no me contó toda la historia.

Past Tense Responses

Did we enjoy the trip, even though it rained a lot?

Sí, disfrutamos el viaje, aunque llovió mucho.

Past Tense Responses

He didn’t answer my call, so I sent him a message.

No respondió mi llamada, así que le envié un mensaje.

Past Simple

I didn’t expect the movie to be so emotional.

No esperaba que la película fuera tan emotiva.

Past Simple

She wasn’t paying attention when the teacher explained the assignment.

Ella no estaba prestando atención cuando el profesor explicó la tarea.

Past Continuous

I wasn’t sleeping well because the neighbors were making noise all night.

No estaba durmiendo bien porque los vecinos hacían ruido toda la noche.

Past Continuous

No, I wasn’t listening because I was distracted by my phone.

No, no estaba escuchando porque estaba distraído con mi teléfono.

Past Tense Responses

No, they weren’t working on the project last night.

No, no estaban trabajando en el proyecto anoche.

Past Tense Responses

Was it raining when you left the house this morning?

¿Estaba lloviendo cuando saliste de casa esta mañana?

Past Continuous

What were you doing when the power went out?

¿Qué estabas haciendo cuando se fue la luz?

Past Continuous

While we were walking in the park, we saw a rare bird.

Mientras caminábamos por el parque, vimos un pájaro raro.

Past Continuous

They were arguing about politics when I entered the room.

Estaban discutiendo sobre política cuando entré en la habitación.

Past Continuous

He was constantly interrupting me during the presentation.

Él me estaba interrumpiendo constantemente durante la presentación.

Past Continuous

I was studying all night while my friends were out partying.

Estuve estudiando toda la noche mientras mis amigos estaban de fiesta.

Past Continuous

Yes, I was studying when the fire alarm went off.

Sí, estaba estudiando cuando se activó la alarma de incendios.

Past Tense Responses

Had you ever seen such a beautiful sunset before that day?

¿Alguna vez habías visto un atardecer tan hermoso antes de ese día?

Past Perfect

I hadn’t realized how serious the situation was until I read the article.

No me había dado cuenta de lo grave que era la situación hasta que leí el artículo.

Past Perfect

No, I hadn’t seen him at the party.

No, no lo había visto en la fiesta.

Past Tense Responses

She had already finished the report before the meeting started.

Ella ya había terminado el informe antes de que comenzara la reunión.

Past Perfect

By the time we arrived, they had already left.

Para cuando llegamos, ellos ya se habían ido.

Past Perfect

He had studied French for five years before moving to Paris.

Él había estudiado francés durante cinco años antes de mudarse a París.

Past Perfect

We had never met her before the conference.

Nunca la habíamos conocido antes de la conferencia.

Past Perfect

The film had already started when we entered the cinema.

La película ya había comenzado cuando entramos al cine.

Past Perfect

I had lost my keys and didn’t know how to get back home.

Había perdido mis llaves y no sabía cómo volver a casa.

Past Perfect

Yes, I had heard about the incident before you mentioned it.

Sí, ya había oído sobre el incidente antes de que lo mencionaras.

Past Tense Responses

Yes, he did apologize after the misunderstanding.

Sí, él se disculpó después del malentendido.

Past Tense Responses

He won the award because he worked hard and stayed focused.

Él ganó el premio porque trabajó duro y se mantuvo enfocado.

Past Simple

They visited Rome and tried authentic Italian food.

Visitaron Roma y probaron comida italiana auténtica.

Past Simple

We watched the documentary and discussed it afterwards.

Vimos el documental y lo discutimos después.

Past Simple

I bought a new laptop because the old one broke down.

Compré un portátil nuevo porque el viejo se averió.

Past Simple

Reductor Paradigma 2 después de la lección POST Parte 3 - Historia Idioms, Slangs, Expressions and Vocabulary - Choco Inglés

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tipo reducción

Tiempo

Verbo Clave

Is she killing it in her career?

¿Está ella haciendo un excelente trabajo en su carrera?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Be (is) + killing

Yes, she’s killing it.

Sí, lo está haciendo muy bien.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Be (is) + killing

Is her job to die for?

¿Su trabajo es muy envidiable?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Be

Yes, her job is to die for.

Sí, su trabajo es muy envidiable.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Be

Are they tearing their hair out?

¿Están muy frustrados?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente continuo

Be (are) + tearing

Yes, they are tearing their hair out.

Sí, están muy frustrados.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente continuo

Be (are) + tearing

Does she give a hoot?

¿Le importa?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Do (does) + give

No, she doesn’t give a hoot.

No, no le importa.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Do (does) + give

Is this café your jam?

¿Este café es tu lugar favorito?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Be

Yes, this café is my jam.

Sí, este café es mi lugar favorito.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Be

Do you want to get the lowdown on me?

¿Quieres saber más sobre mí?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Do (do) + want

Yes, I want to get the lowdown.

Sí, quiero saber más.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Do (do) + want

Are you hitched?

¿Estás casado/a?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Be

No, I’m not hitched.

No, no estoy casado/a.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Be

Are you flying solo right now?

¿Estás soltero/a ahora?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente continuo

Be (are) + flying

Yes, I’m flying solo.

Sí, estoy soltero/a.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente continuo

Be (am) + flying

Did they cook up a plan?

¿Idearon un plan?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Did + cook up

Yes, they cooked up a plan.

Sí, idearon un plan.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Cooked

Did someone nudge her?

¿Alguien la incitó?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Did + nudge

Yes, someone nudged her.

Sí, alguien la incitó.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Nudged

Is she chilling at the coffee shop?

¿Está relajándose en la cafetería?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente continuo

Be (is) + chilling

Yes, she’s chilling there.

Sí, está relajándose allí.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente continuo

Be (is) + chilling

Do you see me here often?

¿Me ves aquí a menudo?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Do (do) + see

Yes, I see you here every day.

Sí, te veo aquí todos los días.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

See

Are you obsessed with coffee?

¿Estás obsesionada con el café?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Be

Yes, I’m obsessed.

Sí, estoy obsesionada.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Be

Do you grab coffee every morning?

¿Tomas café cada mañana?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Do (do) + grab

Yes, I grab coffee here every day.

Sí, tomo café aquí todos los días.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Grab

Would you love to know more?

¿Te encantaría saber más?

Pregunta Positiva

Condicional

Would + love

Yes, I’d love that.

Sí, me encantaría.

Afirmación Positiva

Condicional

Would + love

Are you missing the boat?

¿Estás perdiendo la oportunidad?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente continuo

Be (are) + missing

Yes, I think I’m missing it.

Sí, creo que la estoy perdiendo.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente continuo

Be + missing

Do you feel lonely sometimes?

¿Te sientes solo/a a veces?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Do (do) + feel

Yes, I feel lonely sometimes.

Sí, me siento solo/a a veces.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Feel

Do you think a pet is enough?

¿Crees que una mascota es suficiente?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Do (do) + think

No, I don’t think so.

No, no lo creo.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Think

Pregunta Positiva

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tipo reducción

Tiempo

Do you cram before exams?

Sí, a veces me emociono.

Pregunta Positiva

Yes, I geek out sometimes.

Sí, a veces me emociono.

Sí, tomé valor y estudié.

Pasado

¿Faltaste a clase hoy?

Pasado

No, I did not ditch class.

No, no falté a clase.

Pasado

Sí, él es un cerebrito.

Sí, ella es la favorita del profesor.

Sí, es muy fácil.

Reductor PhraVer+PresPerCon+PresePerf+PastSimpl (Phrasal verbs, extended, Present perfect continuous, Present perfect/past simple) después de la lección M3

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

Why did she turn down the job offer despite the high salary?

¿Por qué rechazó la oferta de trabajo a pesar del alto salario?

Phrasal Verbs

She turned it down because it required her to relocate immediately.

La rechazó porque requería mudarse de inmediato.

Phrasal Verbs

Have you ever run into someone you didn’t expect to see?

¿Alguna vez te has encontrado con alguien que no esperabas ver?

Phrasal Verbs

Yes, I ran into my old math teacher at the airport last week.

Sí, me encontré con mi antiguo profesor de matemáticas en el aeropuerto la semana pasada.

Phrasal Verbs

What do you usually do when a problem comes up at work?

¿Qué sueles hacer cuando surge un problema en el trabajo?

Phrasal Verbs

I try to stay calm and sort it out step by step.

Intento mantener la calma y resolverlo paso a paso.

Phrasal Verbs

Can you think of a situation where you had to back someone up?

¿Puedes pensar en una situación en la que tuviste que respaldar a alguien?

Phrasal Verbs

I had to back up my colleague during a presentation when she forgot her part.

Tuve que respaldar a mi compañera durante una presentación cuando olvidó su parte.

Phrasal Verbs

What’s something you’ve been meaning to carry out but haven’t yet?

¿Qué es algo que has tenido la intención de llevar a cabo pero aún no lo has hecho?

Phrasal Verbs

I've been meaning to carry out a full reorganization of my workspace.

He tenido la intención de hacer una reorganización completa de mi espacio de trabajo.

Phrasal Verbs

How long have you been learning English?

¿Cuánto tiempo llevas aprendiendo inglés?

Present Perfect Continuous

I’ve been learning English for almost five years.

He estado aprendiendo inglés por casi cinco años.

Present Perfect Continuous

What have you been working on lately at your job?

¿En qué has estado trabajando últimamente en tu trabajo?

Present Perfect Continuous

I've been working on a marketing campaign for a new product launch.

He estado trabajando en una campaña de marketing para el lanzamiento de un nuevo producto.

Present Perfect Continuous

Have you been feeling better since you started exercising?

¿Has estado sintiéndote mejor desde que empezaste a hacer ejercicio?

Present Perfect Continuous

Yes, I’ve been feeling much more energetic recently.

Sí, he estado sintiéndome mucho más enérgico últimamente.

Present Perfect Continuous

Why have they been avoiding the topic of the budget?

¿Por qué han estado evitando el tema del presupuesto?

Present Perfect Continuous

They've been avoiding it because the figures are not looking good.

Lo han estado evitando porque las cifras no se ven bien.

Present Perfect Continuous

How long has she been waiting for a response from the university?

¿Cuánto tiempo ha estado esperando una respuesta de la universidad?

Present Perfect Continuous

She has been waiting for over three weeks now.

Ha estado esperando por más de tres semanas ya.

Present Perfect Continuous

Have you ever visited a country where you didn’t speak the language?

¿Alguna vez has visitado un país donde no hablabas el idioma?

Present Perfect / Past Simple

Yes, I visited Japan in 2022 without knowing any Japanese.

Sí, visité Japón en 2022 sin saber nada de japonés.

Present Perfect / Past Simple

Has she already finished the report?

¿Ya ha terminado el informe?

Present Perfect / Past Simple

No, she finished the financial section but still hasn’t completed the conclusion.

No, terminó la sección financiera pero aún no ha completado la conclusión.

Present Perfect / Past Simple

Did you go to the concert last weekend?

¿Fuiste al concierto el fin de semana pasado?

Present Perfect / Past Simple

Yes, I went with some friends and we had a great time.

Sí, fui con algunos amigos y la pasamos muy bien.

Present Perfect / Past Simple

Have you seen the new policies they’ve implemented this year?

¿Has visto las nuevas políticas que han implementado este año?

Present Perfect / Past Simple

Yes, I saw the email about them last Monday.

Sí, vi el correo sobre ellas el lunes pasado.

Present Perfect / Past Simple

How many times have you watched that movie?

¿Cuántas veces has visto esa película?

Present Perfect / Past Simple

I watched it three times last month alone!

¡La vi tres veces solo el mes pasado!

Present Perfect / Past Simple

Reductor Report+SimpPassi+WhQuesPast+Will,GoingTo (Reported speech-range of tenses-, Simple passive, Wh- questions in the past, Will and going to, for prediction) después de la lección Preguntas Debate Historia Secundaria

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

She said she had already completed the assignment before the deadline.

Ella dijo que ya había completado la tarea antes de la fecha límite.

Reported Speech

He told me he was going to quit his job because he wasn’t happy anymore.

Él me dijo que iba a renunciar a su trabajo porque ya no estaba feliz.

Reported Speech

They explained they would be traveling around Europe for a month.

Ellos explicaron que estarían viajando por Europa durante un mes.

Reported Speech

Julia mentioned that she had never seen such a beautiful painting before.

Julia mencionó que nunca había visto una pintura tan hermosa antes.

Reported Speech

My manager said I should send the report by Friday.

Mi gerente dijo que debía enviar el informe para el viernes.

Reported Speech

He asked me if I had been working on the project all week.

Él me preguntó si había estado trabajando en el proyecto toda la semana.

Reported Speech

Anna told us that she couldn't attend the meeting because of a family emergency.

Anna nos dijo que no podía asistir a la reunión debido a una emergencia familiar.

Reported Speech

She wondered whether we had understood the instructions correctly.

Ella se preguntó si habíamos entendido bien las instrucciones.

Reported Speech

The documents were signed by the director yesterday.

Los documentos fueron firmados por el director ayer.

Simple Passive

The new policy was implemented without informing the staff.

La nueva política fue implementada sin informar al personal.

Simple Passive

All the invitations were sent out last week.

Todas las invitaciones fueron enviadas la semana pasada.

Simple Passive

The cake was baked by my grandmother using a traditional recipe.

El pastel fue horneado por mi abuela usando una receta tradicional.

Simple Passive

The problem was solved after several hours of discussion.

El problema fue resuelto después de varias horas de discusión.

Simple Passive

The decision was made during the board meeting.

La decisión fue tomada durante la reunión de la junta.

Simple Passive

Many buildings were damaged in the storm.

Muchos edificios fueron dañados por la tormenta.

Simple Passive

The book was translated into five different languages.

El libro fue traducido a cinco idiomas diferentes.

Simple Passive

Why did you leave the party so early last night?

¿Por qué te fuiste de la fiesta tan temprano anoche?

Wh- Questions in the Past

Where did they spend their vacation last summer?

¿Dónde pasaron sus vacaciones el verano pasado?

Wh- Questions in the Past

What did she say when you told her the news?

¿Qué dijo ella cuando le contaste la noticia?

Wh- Questions in the Past

Who did you meet at the conference last weekend?

¿A quién conociste en la conferencia el fin de semana pasado?

Wh- Questions in the Past

When did he realize he had lost his wallet?

¿Cuándo se dio cuenta de que había perdido su billetera?

Wh- Questions in the Past

How did the accident happen?

¿Cómo ocurrió el accidente?

Wh- Questions in the Past

What time did the train arrive at the station?

¿A qué hora llegó el tren a la estación?

Wh- Questions in the Past

Which book did you choose for the literature class?

¿Qué libro elegiste para la clase de literatura?

Wh- Questions in the Past

I think she will get the job; she has the perfect profile.

Creo que ella conseguirá el trabajo; tiene el perfil perfecto.

Will and Going to (Prediction)

It’s going to rain later — look at those dark clouds!

Va a llover más tarde — ¡mira esas nubes oscuras!

Will and Going to (Prediction)

I'm sure prices will increase after the announcement.

Estoy seguro de que los precios subirán después del anuncio.

Will and Going to (Prediction)

He’s going to fail the test if he doesn’t study tonight.

Va a reprobar el examen si no estudia esta noche.

Will and Going to (Prediction)

That team will probably win the championship this year.

Es probable que ese equipo gane el campeonato este año.

Will and Going to (Prediction)

We’re going to run out of fuel if we don’t stop soon.

Nos vamos a quedar sin combustible si no paramos pronto.

Will and Going to (Prediction)

People will travel to Mars in the next few decades.

Las personas viajarán a Marte en las próximas décadas.

Will and Going to (Prediction)

I think they’re going to announce the results tomorrow.

Creo que van a anunciar los resultados mañana.

Will and Going to (Prediction)

Reductor Paradigma 3 después de la lección Módulo 3 - Aprendamos Vocabulary 2

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tipo de oración

Tiempo

Did the manager pass away?

¿Falleció el gerente?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, he passed away after an attack.

Sí, falleció después de un ataque.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did she give her report?

¿Dio su informe?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, she gave her report.

Sí, dio su informe.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did they walk into the room?

¿Entraron en la sala?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, they walked into the waiting room.

Sí, entraron en la sala de espera.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did the manager kick the bucket?

¿Falleció el gerente? (idiomático)

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, he kicked the bucket.

Sí, falleció.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did they need to find a new one, pronto?

¿Necesitaban encontrar uno nuevo, rápido?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, they needed to find one quickly.

Sí, necesitaban encontrar uno rápidamente.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did she chat up the candidates?

¿Habló con los candidatos?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, she chatted up the candidates.

Sí, habló con los candidatos.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did she chat with them on the sly?

¿Charló con ellos en secreto?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, she chatted with them on the sly.

Sí, charló con ellos discretamente.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did she wrap up her mission?

¿Terminó su misión?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, she wrapped up her mission.

Sí, concluyó su misión.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did she give her scoop?

¿Dio su información?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, she gave her scoop.

Sí, dio su informe.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did they drop the bomb?

¿Anunciaron algo sorprendente?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, they dropped the bomb.

Sí, dieron una noticia sorprendente.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did they find a new manager?

¿Encontraron un nuevo gerente?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, they found a new manager.

Sí, encontraron un nuevo gerente.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did they send the cleaning lady?

¿Enviaron a la señora de la limpieza?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, they sent her to talk to the candidates.

Sí, la enviaron a hablar con los candidatos.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did the candidates have any idea?

¿Tenían idea los candidatos?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

No, they had no clue.

No, no tenían idea.

Afirmación Negativa

Pasado

Did she wrap up the mission?

¿Concluyó la misión?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, she wrapped it up.

Sí, la concluyó.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did they stroll into the waiting room?

¿Pasearon hacia la sala de espera?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, they strolled into the room.

Sí, pasearon hacia la sala.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did they drop the bomb about the manager?

¿Anunciaron al nuevo gerente?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, they dropped the bomb.

Sí, dieron la noticia.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Were those casual encounters?

¿Fueron esos encuentros casuales?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, they were casual encounters.

Sí, fueron encuentros casuales.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Were the owners in a tight spot?

¿Estaban los dueños en apuros?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado continuo

Yes, they were in a tight spot.

Sí, estaban en apuros.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado continuo

Were the chats chill encounters?

¿Fueron los encuentros relajados?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, they were chill encounters.

Sí, fueron encuentros relajados.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Were they focusing on hobbies?

¿Estaban enfocados en pasatiempos?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado continuo

Yes, they were focusing on the weekends.

Sí, estaban enfocados en los fines de semana.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado continuo

Was it part of the plan?

¿Era parte del plan?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, it was part of the plan.

Sí, era parte del plan.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Reductor Idioms/Slangs 3 después de la lección + MÁS SLANGS

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tipo reducción

Tiempo

It costs ten bucks.

Cuesta diez dólares.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Is it a bummer to fail?

¿Es una pena reprobar?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, it is a bummer.

Sí, es una pena.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Do you have cash or card?

¿Tienes efectivo o tarjeta?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

I have cash.

Tengo efectivo.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Do you have change for the bus?

¿Tienes cambio para el bus?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, I have change.

Sí, tengo cambio.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Can you check out this book?

¿Puedes sacar este libro?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, I can check it out.

Sí, puedo sacarlo.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Can you cool it, please?

¿Puedes calmarte, por favor?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, I will cool it.

Sí, me calmaré.

Afirmación Positiva

Futuro

Can you cut it out?

¿Puedes parar?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, I will cut it out.

Sí, lo pararé.

Afirmación Positiva

Futuro

Is she boujee?

¿Ella es sofisticada?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, she is boujee.

Sí, ella es sofisticada.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Is this song cool?

¿Esta canción es genial?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, it is cool.

Sí, es genial.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Is that a cop-out?

¿Eso es una excusa?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, it is a cop-out.

Sí, es una excusa.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Is the food bussin’?

¿La comida está deliciosa?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, the food is bussin’.

Sí, la comida está deliciosa.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Did you cram last night?

¿Repasaste mucho anoche?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, I crammed.

Sí, repasé mucho.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did the cop stop you?

¿El policía te detuvo?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

Yes, the cop stopped me.

Sí, el policía me detuvo.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado

Did you cut class yesterday?

¿Faltaste a clase ayer?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado

No, I did not cut class.

No, no falté a clase.

Afirmación Negativa

Pasado

Are you extra sometimes?

¿Eres exagerado a veces?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, I am extra sometimes.

Sí, soy exagerado a veces.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Does she live rent-free in your mind?

¿Ella vive gratis en tu mente?

Pregunta Positiva

Presente

Yes, she lives rent-free.

Sí, vive gratis en mi mente.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

Reductor First conditional

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

If I study hard, I will pass the exam

Si estudio mucho, aprobaré el examen

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If I eat too much, I will feel sick

Si como demasiado, me sentiré mal

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If I wake up late, I will miss the bus

Si me despierto tarde, perderé el autobús

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If you arrive early, you will get a good seat

Si llegas temprano, conseguirás un buen asiento

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If you help me, you will learn something new

Si me ayudas, aprenderás algo nuevo

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If you wear a coat, you will stay warm

Si te pones un abrigo, te mantendrás caliente

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If he calls me, he will tell me the news

Si él me llama, me contará las noticias

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If he practices every day, he will improve

Si él practica todos los días, mejorará

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If he goes to bed early, he will feel better

Si él se acuesta temprano, se sentirá mejor

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If she saves money, she will buy a new car

Si ella ahorra dinero, comprará un coche nuevo

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If she reads this book, she will understand the story

Si ella lee este libro, entenderá la historia

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If she waters the plants, she will keep them alive

Si ella riega las plantas, las mantendrá vivas

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If it rains tomorrow, it will be cold

Si llueve mañana, hará frío

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If it gets hot, it will melt

Si se calienta, se derretirá

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If it stops working, it will need repair

Si deja de funcionar, necesitará reparación

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If we leave now, we will arrive on time

Si salimos ahora, llegaremos a tiempo

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If we cook dinner together, we will have fun

Si cocinamos la cena juntos, nos divertiremos

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If we invite our friends, we will have a party

Si invitamos a nuestros amigos, tendremos una fiesta

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If they work together, they will finish faster

Si trabajan juntos, terminarán más rápido

First conditional with all subject pronouns

If they listen carefully, they will hear the music

Si escuchan con atención, oirán la música

First conditional with all subject pronouns

Reductor gerund vs. infinitive

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

I enjoy reading books in my free time

Disfruto leyendo libros en mi tiempo libre

Gerund

I love swimming because it's good exercise for my health

Me encanta nadar porque es buen ejercicio para mi salud

Gerund

She stopped working at five o'clock yesterday

Ella dejó de trabajar a las cinco ayer

Gerund

We went shopping at the mall last weekend

Fuimos de compras al centro comercial el fin de semana pasado

Gerund

He keeps talking during the movie

Él sigue hablando durante la película

Gerund

I want to learn Spanish this year

Quiero aprender español este año

Infinitive

She decided to move to a new apartment

Ella decidió mudarse a un nuevo apartamento

Infinitive

They plan to visit Paris next summer

Planean visitar París el próximo verano

Infinitive

We need to buy groceries for dinner

Necesitamos comprar comestibles para la cena

Infinitive

He promised to call me tomorrow

Él prometió llamarme mañana

Infinitive

Reductor Comparatives B1

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

This movie is funnier than the last one we watched

Esta película es más divertida que la última que vimos

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas terminados en -y

My sister is happier now that she has a new job

Mi hermana está más feliz ahora que tiene un nuevo trabajo

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas terminados en -y

The weather is cloudier today than yesterday

El clima está más nublado hoy que ayer

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas terminados en -y

The new apartment is narrower than our old house

El nuevo apartamento es más estrecho que nuestra antigua casa

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas terminados en -ow, -er

This street is quieter than the main road

Esta calle es más tranquila que la carretera principal

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas terminados en -er

My bedroom is smaller than my brother's room

Mi dormitorio es más pequeño que el cuarto de mi hermano

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas terminados en -er

The cake looks nicer than the cookies on the table

El pastel se ve más bonito que las galletas en la mesa

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas terminados en -e

This phone is simpler to use than my old one

Este teléfono es más simple de usar que mi anterior

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas terminados en -e

The park is safer at night than the downtown area

El parque es más seguro por la noche que el centro de la ciudad

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas terminados en -e

The red bag is bigger than the blue one

La bolsa roja es más grande que la azul

Si termina en "consonante-vocal-consonante", dobla la consonante

This summer is hotter than last year's summer

Este verano es más caluroso que el del año pasado

Si termina en "consonante-vocal-consonante", dobla la consonante

My dog is fatter since we moved to the new house

Mi perro está más gordo desde que nos mudamos a la nueva casa

Si termina en "consonante-vocal-consonante", dobla la consonante

Learning English is more common than learning French here

Aprender inglés es más común que aprender francés aquí

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas que pueden usar ambas formas: er y more

This exercise is more simple than the previous one

Este ejercicio es más simple que el anterior

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas que pueden usar ambas formas: er y more

The new teacher is friendlier than the old one

El nuevo profesor es más amigable que el anterior

Comparatives con adjetivos de 2 sílabas que pueden usar ambas formas: er y more

This book is more interesting than the one I read last month

Este libro es más interesante que el que leí el mes pasado

Comparatives con adjetivos de 3 o más sílabas

The new restaurant is more expensive than our usual place

El nuevo restaurante es más caro que nuestro lugar habitual

Comparatives con adjetivos de 3 o más sílabas

My job is more comfortable now than it was before

Mi trabajo es más cómodo ahora que antes

Comparatives con adjetivos de 3 o más sílabas

Reductor Reflexive Pronouns

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

I see myself in the mirror

Me veo en el espejo

Reflexive pronouns - myself

I hurt myself while cooking

Me lastimé mientras cocinaba

Reflexive pronouns - myself

I need to take care of myself

Necesito cuidarme

Reflexive pronouns - myself

You can do it yourself

Puedes hacerlo tú mismo/a

Reflexive pronouns - yourself

You should believe in yourself

Debes creer en ti mismo/a

Reflexive pronouns - yourself

You need to control yourself

Necesitas controlarte

Reflexive pronouns - yourself

He talks to himself

Él se habla a sí mismo

Reflexive pronouns - himself

He cut himself with the knife

Él se cortó con el cuchillo

Reflexive pronouns - himself

He always blames himself

Él siempre se culpa a sí mismo

Reflexive pronouns - himself

She bought herself a dress

Ella se compró un vestido

Reflexive pronouns - herself

She taught herself to paint

Ella aprendió a pintar por sí misma

Reflexive pronouns - herself

She made herself a sandwich

Ella se hizo un sándwich

Reflexive pronouns - herself

The cat cleans itself

El gato se limpia solo

Reflexive pronouns - itself

The door opens by itself

La puerta se abre sola

Reflexive pronouns - itself

The problem will solve itself

El problema se resolverá solo

Reflexive pronouns - itself

We enjoyed ourselves at the party

Nos divertimos en la fiesta

Reflexive pronouns - ourselves

We need to organize ourselves

Necesitamos organizarnos

Reflexive pronouns - ourselves

We should protect ourselves

Debemos protegernos

Reflexive pronouns - ourselves

You all prepared yourselves well

Ustedes se prepararon bien

Reflexive pronouns - yourselves

You all need to help yourselves

Ustedes necesitan ayudarse

Reflexive pronouns - yourselves

You all can see yourselves on TV

Ustedes pueden verse en la televisión

Reflexive pronouns - yourselves

They introduced themselves

Ellos se presentaron

Reflexive pronouns - themselves

They defended themselves bravely

Ellos se defendieron valientemente

Reflexive pronouns - themselves

They found themselves lost

Ellos se encontraron perdidos

Reflexive pronouns - themselves

Reductor Did B1

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

I finished my homework on time yesterday

Yo terminé mi tarea a tiempo ayer

Positive Affirmations with did

She helped her neighbor with the groceries

Ella ayudó a su vecino con las compras

Positive Affirmations with did

We enjoyed the movie last weekend

Nosotros disfrutamos la película el fin de semana pasado

Positive Affirmations with did

He forgot to call his mother

Él olvidó llamar a su madre

Positive Affirmations with did

They arrived at the party early

Ellos llegaron temprano a la fiesta

Positive Affirmations with did

I did'nt understand the lesson today

No entendí la lección hoy

Negative Affirmations with did

She didn't buy anything at the store

Ella no compró nada en la tienda

Negative Affirmations with did

We did'nt visit the museum yesterday

No visitamos el museo ayer

Negative Affirmations with did

He did'nt eat breakfast this morning

Él no desayunó esta mañana

Negative Affirmations with did

They did'nt watch the football game

Ellos no vieron el partido de fútbol

Negative Affirmations with did

Reductor Used to vs Would

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

I used to play football when I was younger

Solía jugar fútbol cuando era más joven

used to

She used to live in Paris before moving here

Ella solía vivir en París antes de mudarse aquí

used to

We used to go camping every summer

Solíamos ir de camping todos los veranos

used to

He used to work as a teacher before becoming a doctor

Él solía trabajar como profesor antes de convertirse en médico

used to

They used to have a dog but it passed away

Ellos solían tener un perro pero murió

used to

Would you like some coffee or tea?

¿Te gustaría café o té?

Would

I would travel around the world if I had enough money

Viajaría por el mundo si tuviera suficiente dinero

Would

She would always help her neighbors when they needed it

Ella siempre ayudaba a sus vecinos cuando lo necesitaban

Would

Would you mind closing the window, please?

¿Te importaría cerrar la ventana, por favor?

Would

He said he would call me later tonight

Él dijo que me llamaría más tarde esta noche

Would

Reductor Adverbs with and without have

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

She has always remembered her grandmother's birthday

Ella siempre ha recordado el cumpleaños de su abuela

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

She always remembers to lock the door

Ella siempre recuerda cerrar la puerta con llave

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

They have never visited that museum before

Nunca han visitado ese museo antes

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

They never eat fast food on weekdays

Nunca comen comida rápida entre semana

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

We have often discussed this problem at work

Hemos discutido este problema en el trabajo a menudo

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

We often go to the cinema on Fridays

A menudo vamos al cine los viernes

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

He has sometimes forgotten to call his parents

A veces se ha olvidado de llamar a sus padres

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

He sometimes forgets his keys at home

A veces se olvida las llaves en casa

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

I have usually finished my homework by dinner time

Normalmente he terminado mis deberes para la hora de cenar

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

I usually wake up at seven in the morning

Normalmente me despierto a las siete de la mañana

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

You have completely understood the lesson today

Has entendido completamente la lección hoy

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

You completely forgot about the meeting yesterday

Te olvidaste completamente de la reunión ayer

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

Reductor If Clauses

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

If she studied harder, she would pass the exam

Si ella estudiara más, aprobaría el examen

3rd person singular - Second conditional

If he lived in Paris, he would speak French fluently

Si él viviera en París, hablaría francés con fluidez

3rd person singular - Second conditional

If it rained tomorrow, the picnic would be cancelled

Si lloviera mañana, el picnic sería cancelado

3rd person singular - Second conditional

If I had more money, I would travel around the world

Si tuviera más dinero, viajaría por todo el mundo

Other pronouns - Second conditional

If we won the lottery, we would buy a new house

Si ganáramos la lotería, compraríamos una casa nueva

Other pronouns - Second conditional

If you moved to London, you would miss your family

Si te mudaras a Londres, extrañarías a tu familia

Other pronouns - Second conditional

If she always arrived on time, her boss would be happy

Si ella siempre llegara a tiempo, su jefe estaría contento

Second conditional with adverbs

If he sometimes helped with housework, his wife would definitely appreciate it

Si él a veces ayudara con las tareas domésticas, su esposa definitivamente lo apreciaría

Second conditional with adverbs

If we really tried harder, we would surely succeed

Si realmente nos esforzáramos más, seguramente tendríamos éxito

Second conditional with adverbs

If they never complained, the service would probably improve

Si ellos nunca se quejaran, el servicio probablemente mejoraría

Second conditional with adverbs

If I often visited my grandmother, she would usually cook for me

Si visitara a mi abuela a menudo, ella usualmente cocinaría para mí

Second conditional with adverbs

Reductor Should Have+Must have

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

She should have called her mother yesterday

Ella debería haber llamado a su madre ayer

3rd person of the singular - Should have sentences

He should have studied harder for the exam

Él debería haber estudiado más para el examen

3rd person of the singular - Should have sentences

Tom should have arrived at the office early

Tom debería haber llegado temprano a la oficina

3rd person of the singular - Should have sentences

You should have told me about the meeting

Deberías haberme contado sobre la reunión

Other pronouns - Should have sentences

We should have bought tickets in advance

Deberíamos haber comprado los boletos con anticipación

Other pronouns - Should have sentences

They should have finished their homework by now

Ellos deberían haber terminado su tarea para ahora

Other pronouns - Should have sentences

She must have forgotten her keys at home

Ella debe haber olvidado sus llaves en casa

3rd person of the singular - Must have sentences

David must have taken the wrong bus today

David debe haber tomado el autobús equivocado hoy

3rd person of the singular - Must have sentences

The teacher must have explained this lesson before

El profesor debe haber explicado esta lección antes

3rd person of the singular - Must have sentences

You must have seen the movie already

Debes haber visto la película ya

Other pronouns - Must have sentences

We must have walked for two hours now

Debemos haber caminado por dos horas ya

Other pronouns - Must have sentences

They must have heard the news yesterday

Ellos deben haber escuchado las noticias ayer

Other pronouns - Must have sentences

She always arrives at work on time

Ella siempre llega al trabajo a tiempo

3rd person of the singular - Adverb: always

You never listen to my advice

Nunca escuchas mis consejos

Other pronouns - Adverb: never

He often visits his grandmother on weekends

Él a menudo visita a su abuela los fines de semana

3rd person of the singular - Adverb: often

We sometimes go to the cinema together

A veces vamos al cine juntos

Other pronouns - Adverb: sometimes

Lisa usually has breakfast at seven o'clock

Lisa usualmente desayuna a las siete

3rd person of the singular - Adverb: usually

Reductor Enough

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

I am good enough at English to have a conversation

Soy lo suficientemente bueno/a en inglés para mantener una conversación

Other pronouns --- Enough after adjectives

I am tired enough to go to bed early

Estoy lo suficientemente cansado/a para acostarme temprano

Other pronouns --- Enough after adjectives

I am brave enough to try the new restaurant

Soy lo suficientemente valiente para probar el restaurante nuevo

Other pronouns --- Enough after adjectives

She is tall enough to reach the top shelf

Ella es lo suficientemente alta para alcanzar el estante superior

3rd person of the singular --- Enough after adjectives

He is smart enough to solve this problem

Él es lo suficientemente inteligente para resolver este problema

3rd person of the singular --- Enough after adjectives

It is warm enough to go swimming today

Hace lo suficientemente calor para ir a nadar hoy

3rd person of the singular --- Enough after adjectives

We are strong enough to move this table

Somos lo suficientemente fuertes para mover esta mesa

Other pronouns --- Enough after adjectives

You are old enough to drive a car

Eres lo suficientemente mayor para conducir un coche

Other pronouns --- Enough after adjectives

They are fast enough to catch the bus

Son lo suficientemente rápidos para coger el autobús

Other pronouns --- Enough after adjectives

I have enough books to read this summer

Tengo suficientes libros para leer este verano

Other pronouns --- Enough before nouns

I need enough coffee to wake up in the morning

Necesito suficiente café para despertarme por la mañana

Other pronouns --- Enough before nouns

I brought enough clothes for the weekend trip

Traje suficiente ropa para el viaje de fin de semana

Other pronouns --- Enough before nouns

She has enough money to buy the dress

Ella tiene suficiente dinero para comprar el vestido

3rd person of the singular --- Enough before nouns

He gets enough sleep every night

Él duerme lo suficiente cada noche

3rd person of the singular --- Enough before nouns

It needs enough water to grow properly

Necesita suficiente agua para crecer correctamente

3rd person of the singular --- Enough before nouns

We have enough time to finish the project

Tenemos suficiente tiempo para terminar el proyecto

Other pronouns --- Enough before nouns

You need enough practice to improve your skills

Necesitas suficiente práctica para mejorar tus habilidades

Other pronouns --- Enough before nouns

They brought enough food for the picnic

Trajeron suficiente comida para el picnic

Other pronouns --- Enough before nouns

Reductor Phrasal verbs B1

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tema

She turns her music down when studying

Ella baja el volumen de su música cuando estudia

3rd person of the singular --- Phrasal verbs with a word in between

He picks his clothes up from the floor

Él recoge su ropa del suelo

3rd person of the singular --- Phrasal verbs with a word in between

She gives her old books away to charity

Ella dona sus libros viejos a la caridad

3rd person of the singular --- Phrasal verbs with a word in between

He throws his papers away after the exam

Él tira sus papeles después del examen

3rd person of the singular --- Phrasal verbs with a word in between

We turn our phones off during the movie

Nosotros apagamos nuestros teléfonos durante la película

Other pronouns --- Phrasal verbs with a word in between

They put their shoes on before leaving

Ellos se ponen sus zapatos antes de salir

Other pronouns --- Phrasal verbs with a word in between

You should write your ideas down quickly

Deberías escribir tus ideas rápidamente

Other pronouns --- Phrasal verbs with a word in between

I look my words up in the dictionary

Yo busco mis palabras en el diccionario

Other pronouns --- Phrasal verbs with a word in between

She looks after children at the daycare

Ella cuida niños en la guardería

3rd person of the singular --- Phrasal verbs with the word after the verb

He gets up early every morning

Él se levanta temprano cada mañana

3rd person of the singular --- Phrasal verbs with the word after the verb

She runs into old friends at the mall

Ella se encuentra con viejos amigos en el centro comercial

3rd person of the singular --- Phrasal verbs with the word after the verb

He goes on vacation twice a year

Él se va de vacaciones dos veces al año

3rd person of the singular --- Phrasal verbs with the word after the verb

We grow up in the same neighborhood

Nosotros crecemos en el mismo barrio

Other pronouns --- Phrasal verbs with the word after the verb

They come back from work at six

Ellos regresan del trabajo a las seis

Other pronouns --- Phrasal verbs with the word after the verb

You should calm down before the meeting

Deberías calmarte antes de la reunión

Other pronouns --- Phrasal verbs with the word after the verb

I break down when I'm too stressed

Yo me vengo abajo cuando estoy muy estresado

Other pronouns --- Phrasal verbs with the word after the verb
B1 Evaluación Comprensión
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 4

Va a evaluar las estructuras que debe manejar en ese nivel como tiempos y verbos.

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 4

Debe poder comprender cualquiera de las siguientes lecturas

Lecturas a Evaluar
Lectura 1 Comprensión Nivel B1

1. My Family
I have a close relationship with my family. Although we are all busy, we always make time for each other. My older sister is studying at university, and my younger brother is still in high school. We like to play board games or go for walks together when we can.

2. My House
I live in an apartment in the city center. It’s convenient because everything is nearby, like shops and my school. My apartment has three bedrooms, a kitchen, and a small balcony. I enjoy sitting on the balcony in the evening and watching the sunset.

3. My Best Friend
My best friend, Alex, is someone I trust a lot. We’ve known each other since childhood, and we share many memories. He’s good at solving problems and always gives me advice. When I feel stressed, Alex knows how to cheer me up.

Lectura 2 Comprensión Nivel B1

4. My Favorite Food
I enjoy trying new dishes, but my favorite food will always be sushi. I like the combination of fresh fish and rice. I also love desserts, especially chocolate cake. When I go to restaurants, I usually try to order something different every time.

5. A Day at School
School can be both fun and challenging. I enjoy learning new things, especially in science and literature. My teachers are helpful, and I often ask questions during class. After school, I sometimes stay to practice with the drama club, which is one of my favorite activities.

6. My Hobbies
My hobbies keep me busy and help me relax. I love writing short stories because it allows me to express my ideas. I also enjoy hiking in the mountains. Photography is another hobby I’ve started recently, and I’m learning how to take better pictures.

7. The Weather
Weather can affect my mood a lot. When it’s sunny, I feel more energetic and motivated. However, on rainy days, I prefer staying indoors and reading a good book. Winter is not my favorite season because it’s too cold, but I love the snow.

Lectura 3 Comprensión Nivel B1

pinky is between a rock and a hard place his owner wants to kick him out of the house. Just this morning, he got in trouble. When his owner was at the supermarket buying some things for lunch, pinky sat on the table. Beside him, on the table, there was tuna so pinky ate it. Then he saw a pot in front of him, so he jumped and fell inside the pot that had fish soup in it. The pot wasn’t hot yet. His owner had left the pot on low heat for safety while she was at the supermarket. pinky ate so much that he fell asleep inside the pot. When his owner came home, she put the pot on the high heat and started looking for pinky, but he was well hidden—he was inside the pot. After a few minutes, his owner heard the pot moving violently. Could it be that a fish was alive? pinky’s owner uncovered the pot, and something furry shot out. It was pinky, who was terrified and hid under the table. His owner tried to get him out from under the table with a broom, but pinky climbed up her face and hid behind the stove in front of the fridge. However, he was too near the hot pot, so hid beside the cold fridge. When his owner was gonna reach him he jumped, went outside, and scrambled up a tree. pinky is still outside in the tree. He doesn't want to come down, but he is very hungry, so he’s still between a rock and a hard place.

Lectura 4 Comprensión Nivel B1

Sarah is happy today. She was sad yesterday, but has been feeling better since this morning. Sarah has a new hobby. She had tried many before, but had never found the right one. She does puzzles now. She did one yesterday and has done three this week. Sarah goes to the park often. She went there last weekend and has gone there every day this week. She gets excited about nature. She got a new plant yesterday and has gotten interested in gardening. Sarah makes time for her hobbies. She made a schedule last month and has made good progress. She takes photos of her plants. She took a beautiful picture yesterday and has taken many since then. Her friend comes to visit sometimes. He came last week and has come twice this month. They see each other regularly. They saw a movie together recently and have seen many interesting plants in the park.

Lectura 5 Comprensión Nivel B1

Max brings his camera everywhere. He brought it to the beach last summer and has brought it on every trip since. He builds confidence in his photography skills daily. He built a small studio at home last year and has built quite a portfolio. Max buys photography books often. He bought a new lens last month and has bought several accessories this year. He chooses his subjects carefully. He chose to focus on nature photography last spring and has chosen to explore urban landscapes recently.

Max drinks coffee while editing photos. He drank three cups during an all-night editing session and has drunk more green tea lately for health reasons. He drives to scenic locations for shoots. He drove to the mountains last weekend and has driven thousands of miles for his art. Max eats healthy to stay energized. He ate a big breakfast before a dawn shoot yesterday and has eaten more vegetables since starting his fitness routine.

Sometimes, Max falls asleep editing late at night. He fell asleep at his desk last week and has fallen into the habit of setting alarms. He never forgets his camera. He forgot extra batteries once last year but has forgotten nothing since that lesson. Max's skills grow constantly. His talent grew noticeably last year, and he has grown into a respected photographer in his community.

Lecturas a Evaluar
Lectura 1 Comprensión Nivel B1

1. My Family
I have a close relationship with my family. Although we are all busy, we always make time for each other. My older sister is studying at university, and my younger brother is still in high school. We like to play board games or go for walks together when we can.

2. My House
I live in an apartment in the city center. It’s convenient because everything is nearby, like shops and my school. My apartment has three bedrooms, a kitchen, and a small balcony. I enjoy sitting on the balcony in the evening and watching the sunset.

3. My Best Friend
My best friend, Alex, is someone I trust a lot. We’ve known each other since childhood, and we share many memories. He’s good at solving problems and always gives me advice. When I feel stressed, Alex knows how to cheer me up.

Lectura 2 Comprensión Nivel B1

4. My Favorite Food
I enjoy trying new dishes, but my favorite food will always be sushi. I like the combination of fresh fish and rice. I also love desserts, especially chocolate cake. When I go to restaurants, I usually try to order something different every time.

5. A Day at School
School can be both fun and challenging. I enjoy learning new things, especially in science and literature. My teachers are helpful, and I often ask questions during class. After school, I sometimes stay to practice with the drama club, which is one of my favorite activities.

6. My Hobbies
My hobbies keep me busy and help me relax. I love writing short stories because it allows me to express my ideas. I also enjoy hiking in the mountains. Photography is another hobby I’ve started recently, and I’m learning how to take better pictures.

7. The Weather
Weather can affect my mood a lot. When it’s sunny, I feel more energetic and motivated. However, on rainy days, I prefer staying indoors and reading a good book. Winter is not my favorite season because it’s too cold, but I love the snow.

Lectura 3 Comprensión Nivel B1

pinky is between a rock and a hard place his owner wants to kick him out of the house. Just this morning, he got in trouble. When his owner was at the supermarket buying some things for lunch, pinky sat on the table. Beside him, on the table, there was tuna so pinky ate it. Then he saw a pot in front of him, so he jumped and fell inside the pot that had fish soup in it. The pot wasn’t hot yet. His owner had left the pot on low heat for safety while she was at the supermarket. pinky ate so much that he fell asleep inside the pot. When his owner came home, she put the pot on the high heat and started looking for pinky, but he was well hidden—he was inside the pot. After a few minutes, his owner heard the pot moving violently. Could it be that a fish was alive? pinky’s owner uncovered the pot, and something furry shot out. It was pinky, who was terrified and hid under the table. His owner tried to get him out from under the table with a broom, but pinky climbed up her face and hid behind the stove in front of the fridge. However, he was too near the hot pot, so hid beside the cold fridge. When his owner was gonna reach him he jumped, went outside, and scrambled up a tree. pinky is still outside in the tree. He doesn't want to come down, but he is very hungry, so he’s still between a rock and a hard place.

Lectura 4 Comprensión Nivel B1

Sarah is happy today. She was sad yesterday, but has been feeling better since this morning. Sarah has a new hobby. She had tried many before, but had never found the right one. She does puzzles now. She did one yesterday and has done three this week. Sarah goes to the park often. She went there last weekend and has gone there every day this week. She gets excited about nature. She got a new plant yesterday and has gotten interested in gardening. Sarah makes time for her hobbies. She made a schedule last month and has made good progress. She takes photos of her plants. She took a beautiful picture yesterday and has taken many since then. Her friend comes to visit sometimes. He came last week and has come twice this month. They see each other regularly. They saw a movie together recently and have seen many interesting plants in the park.

Lectura 5 Comprensión Nivel B1

Max brings his camera everywhere. He brought it to the beach last summer and has brought it on every trip since. He builds confidence in his photography skills daily. He built a small studio at home last year and has built quite a portfolio. Max buys photography books often. He bought a new lens last month and has bought several accessories this year. He chooses his subjects carefully. He chose to focus on nature photography last spring and has chosen to explore urban landscapes recently.

Max drinks coffee while editing photos. He drank three cups during an all-night editing session and has drunk more green tea lately for health reasons. He drives to scenic locations for shoots. He drove to the mountains last weekend and has driven thousands of miles for his art. Max eats healthy to stay energized. He ate a big breakfast before a dawn shoot yesterday and has eaten more vegetables since starting his fitness routine.

Sometimes, Max falls asleep editing late at night. He fell asleep at his desk last week and has fallen into the habit of setting alarms. He never forgets his camera. He forgot extra batteries once last year but has forgotten nothing since that lesson. Max's skills grow constantly. His talent grew noticeably last year, and he has grown into a respected photographer in his community.

B1 Evaluación Speaking
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 5

Hace las preguntas para evaluar su capacidad de comunicarse y hablar en inglés

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 5

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel básico

Preguntas para evaluar el speaking
🗣 Personal Information

  1. What do you do for a living?

  2. Can you describe your daily routine?

  3. What are your hobbies and interests?

  4. How do you usually spend your weekends?

  5. Can you describe your best friend?

  6. What are your strengths and weaknesses?

  7. What kind of music do you like?

  8. What do you usually do in your free time?

  9. Can you tell me about your hometown?

  10. What languages do you speak?

🧳 Travel and Holidays

  1. Have you ever traveled abroad? Where?

  2. What’s your dream travel destination?

  3. How do you usually prepare for a trip?

  4. Do you prefer the beach or the mountains? Why?

  5. What’s the best vacation you’ve ever had?

🍝 Food and Drink

  1. What’s your favorite food or meal?

  2. Can you cook? What dishes can you make?

  3. What did you eat for breakfast today?

  4. Do you prefer eating out or at home?

  5. Is there a traditional dish from your country you recommend?

📚 Education and Learning

  1. What subjects did you like most in school?

  2. How do you prefer to learn new things?

  3. Have you ever taken an online course?

  4. What’s the most useful thing you’ve learned this year?

  5. Why are you learning English?

💼 Work and Career

  1. What’s your ideal job?

  2. Do you enjoy working in a team or alone?

  3. Have you ever had a part-time job?

  4. What skills are important for your job?

  5. What are your professional goals for the next five years?

🏠 Home and Daily Life

  1. Can you describe your home?

  2. Do you live alone or with others?

  3. What chores do you usually do at home?

  4. What would you change about your neighborhood?

  5. What’s your morning routine like?

🧠 Opinions and Preferences

  1. What do you think about social media?

  2. Do you prefer watching movies or reading books? Why?

  3. What do you think makes a good friend?

  4. Are you a morning person or a night owl?

  5. What do you think about working from home?

🌍 Society and Culture

  1. What’s a typical celebration in your country?

  2. How is your culture different from others you know?

  3. What’s a local tradition you enjoy?

  4. What do you usually do on public holidays?

  5. Do you think it’s important to learn about other cultures?

🩺 Health and Lifestyle

  1. How do you stay healthy?

  2. Do you do any sports or physical activities?

  3. What do you do when you feel stressed?

  4. How often do you go to the doctor?

  5. What habits would you like to improve?

Preguntas para evaluar el speaking
🗣 Personal Information

  1. What do you do for a living?

  2. Can you describe your daily routine?

  3. What are your hobbies and interests?

  4. How do you usually spend your weekends?

  5. Can you describe your best friend?

  6. What are your strengths and weaknesses?

  7. What kind of music do you like?

  8. What do you usually do in your free time?

  9. Can you tell me about your hometown?

  10. What languages do you speak?

🧳 Travel and Holidays

  1. Have you ever traveled abroad? Where?

  2. What’s your dream travel destination?

  3. How do you usually prepare for a trip?

  4. Do you prefer the beach or the mountains? Why?

  5. What’s the best vacation you’ve ever had?

🍝 Food and Drink

  1. What’s your favorite food or meal?

  2. Can you cook? What dishes can you make?

  3. What did you eat for breakfast today?

  4. Do you prefer eating out or at home?

  5. Is there a traditional dish from your country you recommend?

📚 Education and Learning

  1. What subjects did you like most in school?

  2. How do you prefer to learn new things?

  3. Have you ever taken an online course?

  4. What’s the most useful thing you’ve learned this year?

  5. Why are you learning English?

💼 Work and Career

  1. What’s your ideal job?

  2. Do you enjoy working in a team or alone?

  3. Have you ever had a part-time job?

  4. What skills are important for your job?

  5. What are your professional goals for the next five years?

🏠 Home and Daily Life

  1. Can you describe your home?

  2. Do you live alone or with others?

  3. What chores do you usually do at home?

  4. What would you change about your neighborhood?

  5. What’s your morning routine like?

🧠 Opinions and Preferences

  1. What do you think about social media?

  2. Do you prefer watching movies or reading books? Why?

  3. What do you think makes a good friend?

  4. Are you a morning person or a night owl?

  5. What do you think about working from home?

🌍 Society and Culture

  1. What’s a typical celebration in your country?

  2. How is your culture different from others you know?

  3. What’s a local tradition you enjoy?

  4. What do you usually do on public holidays?

  5. Do you think it’s important to learn about other cultures?

🩺 Health and Lifestyle

  1. How do you stay healthy?

  2. Do you do any sports or physical activities?

  3. What do you do when you feel stressed?

  4. How often do you go to the doctor?

  5. What habits would you like to improve?

B1 Evaluación Herramientas
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 6
  • Asegurarse de que todos los estudiantes tienen las actividades de este nivel realizadas para poder ser aprobados en esta evaluación.
  • El profesor hace una evaluación del ANKI de cada estudiante tal y como se hace en las clases en vivo regulares; la diferencia radica en que el profesor evalúa (sin previo aviso) diferentes contenidos al mismo estudiante en la misma clase
Actividades a realizar
  1. Audios Diarios: 74 publicaciones subidas
  2. Actividades de la plataforma: 33 publicaciones subidas
  3. Tests: 14 tests aprobados subidas
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 6
  • Plataforma y herramientas: Conocer todo el contenido del ANKI.
  • Herramienta de reducción de ruido: Que pueda entender cualquier audio de reducción de ruido
Reducción de Ruido a Evaluar (Las mismas del nivel)

Reductor Preposiciones y Acciones después de la lección Preposiciones

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Are the kids playing outside?

¿Están los niños jugando afuera?

Yes, they are playing outside.

Sí, están jugando fuera.

Are your keys at home?

¿Están tus llaves en casa?

No, they are not at home.

No, no están en casa.

Was he behind the door?

¿Estaba él detrás de la puerta?

Yes, he was behind the door.

Sí, estaba detrás de la puerta.

Is the cat on the table?

¿Está el gato sobre la mesa?

Yes, it is on the table.

Sí, está sobre la mesa.

Is the ball under the chair?

¿Está la pelota debajo de la silla?

Yes, it is under the chair.

Sí, está debajo de la silla.

Is the park near your house?

¿Está el parque cerca de tu casa?

Yes, it is near my house.

Sí, está cerca de mi casa.

Is the store between the banks?

¿Está la tienda entre los bancos?

Yes, it is between them.

Sí, está entre ellos.

Is your phone inside the drawer?

¿Está tu celular dentro del cajón?

Yes, it is inside the drawer.

Sí, está dentro del cajón.

Is the car in front of the house?

¿Está el carro frente a la casa?

Yes, it is in front of the house.

Sí, está frente a la casa.

Is she sitting beside you?

¿Está ella sentada a tu lado?

Yes, she is sitting beside me.

Sí, está sentada a mi lado.

Where is the book?

¿Dónde está el libro?

It is in the bag.

Está en la bolsa.

Reductor Acciones 4

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Tipo de oración

Tiempo

Verbo Clave

Did you hear the noise?

¿Escuchaste el ruido?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado simple

hear

Yes, I heard it.

Sí, lo escuché.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

hear

Did she forget her bag?

¿Olvidó ella su bolso?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado simple

forget

Yes, she forgot it.

Sí, lo olvidó.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

forget

I pay every week.

Yo pago cada semana.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

pay

He paid yesterday.

Él pagó ayer.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

pay

Did he stand at the door?

¿Estuvo él de pie en la puerta?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado simple

stand

Yes, he stood there.

Sí, estuvo allí.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

stand

They fight all the time.

Ellos pelean todo el tiempo.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

fight

They fought last night.

Ellos pelearon anoche.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

fight

I think you are right.

Creo que tienes razón.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente

think

I thought about that.

Pensé en eso.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

think

He lost his keys.

Él perdió sus llaves.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

lose

Did she catch the ball?

¿Ella atrapó la pelota?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado simple

catch

Yes, she caught it.

Sí, la atrapó.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

catch

I laid the book on the table.

Puse el libro sobre la mesa.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

lay

She lent me a pencil.

Ella me prestó un lápiz.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

lend

He has proven his idea.

Él ha probado su idea.

Afirmación Positiva

Presente perfecto

prove

She burned the toast.

Ella quemó el pan tostado.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

burn

They dealt with the problem.

Ellos trataron el problema.

Afirmación Positiva

Pasado simple

deal

Did the balloon burst?

¿Explotó el globo?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado simple

burst

Yes, it burst.

Sí, explotó.

Afirmación Positiva
